author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: My 100th CMF!
review:
Opening;

The Figure Skating Champion is, for me, greatly sentimental due to its numbering in terms of sets I have acquired. The Minifigure however, I would say is not bad, but not the Champion of the CMF series.

The Minifigure-

He has a hairpiece introduced in 2021 in a yellow colour, his face features a large grin with some glitter detail, his torso has further glittering on its light blue base, and the legs are unprinted in the same blue colour.

The accessories -

The only accessories per-say are a pair of silver ice skates, which are expected and inevitable. The stand is the standard black CMF stand with a 1×2 black jumper plate and an action pose piece, so the figure can be on the stand with the skates on.

In conclusion-

This isn't a mind-blowing Minifigure, I'm afraid to say I'm sick of the winter sports/performance Minifigures I CMF series, the trope has been done to death. The hair and torso are nice elements, but they don't save the figure. But, completionists have this figure already, and if you want it, I see no issue with recommending this to anyone who is even partially interested, you won't be disappointed.
